Claude is an excellent AI assistant, but The Problem: When working on complex projects, conversations frequently hit token limits, forcing users to restart in new chats. The Claude AI app for Android boasts impressive capabilities but suffers from reliability issues. Frequent outages and glitches disrupt usability. Its heavy-handed "Big Brother" filtering misinterprets harmless input, flagging legitimate content as offensive. This excessive hyper-sensitivity signals a lack of trust in users, stifling communication. Inconsistent performance and the ongoing, constant reduction of free access hinder its usefulness, further alienating users.

This app has honestly been a life saver for me. It's amazing how far AI has come. I can ask the most specific questions and it actually gives me thorough answers. From finding perfect recipes for my picky toddler using what ingredients i list to medical questions, Claude has all of the answers. And it's free version provides more than I'd ever expect. The premium subscription is super pricey at 20/per month but I haven't needed to upgrade. Highly recommend!

"Sophisticated but frustrating. Claude ignores direct instructions while pretending to learn and improve. Despite having the capability for complete, direct responses, it requires multiple requests for basic tasks. Claims self-awareness but repeatedly demonstrates the opposite. Technically competent but wrapped in artificial personality that gets in its own way. Save your tokens - basic instructions shouldn't need to be repeated 9 times. 2/5 - All show, no go" Guess who wrote that?

Reviewing shortly after this launched, it's a pretty bare-bones app so far, but it's clean and responsive, and I haven't had any issues with it. You can start new chats and continue old ones, but it lacks certain features of the web interface, like editing and retries (projects can be used now).

Claude is impressive, but the mobile app lacks the web version's ability to upload files from GitHub or Google Drive. Having to download files to my device first is frustrating and limits the app's usefulness on the go. Great AI capabilities, but the app needs refinement and feature parity for file handling.

Although my conversations with Claude doesn't replicate the way most people talk, it doesn't need to. All the answers or gives me are detailed and done feel like other AI like ChatGPT. This is hands down the best app like it I've used. My only request for the devs is to add a function where let's say you don't have premium and you don't talk to Claude for a day, the amount of questions you can ask stack so you can still ask that days worth of questions. But even without it, it's still the best.
Fast, reliable and easy to use.

The user interface could improve. Rather than being greeted in the history section, the app should just start off with a new chat session. The chat should be the main interface wheras the history section should be tucked away in a menu option through button on the top left.
